main_definition: To an insignificant or minimal degree; only just enough to meet a requirement, standard, or expectation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not at all or in any way
meanings_and_examples.example: She could barely keep her eyes open after such an exhausting day.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Just enough to manage a situation without failing
meanings_and_examples.example: He barely passed the exam by getting 51% of the marks required.
The hikers were barely able to reach the summit before nightfall.
The soup was only barely hot enough when it arrived at our table.

meanings_and_examples.definition: On the edge of success or failure, just avoiding disaster
meanings_and_examples.example: They were barely able to keep their business afloat during the economic downturn.
